usefulItems: baking tray and paper, oven, freezer
title: Gruyère-Stuffed Salmon Patties with Salad

ingredients.content: 80 g white bread, cut in pieces
350 g floury potatoes, peeled, cut in cubes (1 cm)
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
1 tsp freshly ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
30 g spring onions, cut in pieces
350 g fresh salmon fillets, skinless, cut in pieces (3 cm)
80 g Gruyère cheese, cut in 8 pieces
100 g cherry tomatoes, cut in halves

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place white bread in mixing bowl and chop <b>15 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Place olive oil, butter, potatoes, water, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl then cook <b>15 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, and then mash <b>30 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place spring onions and salmon fillets in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>.

Add reserved mashed potatoes and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Spread the salmon mixture evenly on a plate, lightly score with a knife to divide into 8 and freeze for 10 minutes.

Take ⅛ of the salmon mixture (approx. 60 g), push a piece of Gruyère cheese into it and shape into patties (2 cm thick). Coat with breadcrumbs and arrange on prepared baking tray. Repeat for remaining 7 patties. Bake for 20 minutes (180°C). Meanwhile prepare the salad.

Place a serving bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh baby leaf salad and cherry tomatoes into it and set aside. Season salad with salt, ground pepper, olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Serve the patties hot with the salad.

hintsAndTricks: Make the patties ahead of time and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 hours, until ready to cook.
Try this recipe with a different cheese, such as cheddar, brie or dolcelatte.
